segment.source: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files
segment.target: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files

segment.source: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files
segment.target: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files

segment.source: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files
segment.target: How to Change the Log Reporting Levels and Reset the Log Files

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to change the log reporting level from the Application Virtualization node in the Application Virtualization Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to change the log reporting level from the Application Virtualization node in the Application Virtualization Management Console.

segment.source: When the log file reaches the maximum size (default is 256 MB), a reset is forced when the next write to the log occurs.
segment.target: When the log file reaches the maximum size (default is 256 MB), a reset is forced when the next write to the log occurs.

segment.source: A reset causes a new log file to be created, and the old file is renamed as a backup.
segment.target: A reset causes a new log file to be created, and the old file is renamed as a backup.

segment.source: To change the log reporting level
segment.target: To change the log reporting level

segment.source: Right-click the Application Virtualization node, and select Properties from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the Application Virtualization node, and select Properties from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, from the Log Level drop-down list, select the desired log level.
segment.target: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, from the Log Level drop-down list, select the desired log level.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you choose Verbose as the logging level, the log files will grow large very quickly.
segment.target: If you choose Verbose as the logging level, the log files will grow large very quickly.

segment.source: This might inhibit client performance, so best practice is to use this log level only for diagnosing specific problems.
segment.target: This might inhibit client performance, so best practice is to use this log level only for diagnosing specific problems.

segment.source: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, from the System Log Level drop-down list, select the desired log level.
segment.target: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, from the System Log Level drop-down list, select the desired log level.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The System Log Level setting controls the level of messages sent to the system event log.
segment.target: The System Log Level setting controls the level of messages sent to the system event log.

segment.source: The logged messages are identical to the messages that get logged to the client event log, but they are stored in a different location.
segment.target: The logged messages are identical to the messages that get logged to the client event log, but they are stored in a different location.

segment.source: Click OK or Apply to change the setting.
segment.target: Click OK or Apply to change the setting.

segment.source: To reset the log file
segment.target: To reset the log file

segment.source: Right-click the Application Virtualization node, and select Properties from the pop-up menu.
segment.target: Right-click the Application Virtualization node, and select Properties from the pop-up menu.

segment.source: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, click Reset Log to back up the current log file and immediately start a new log file.
segment.target: On the General tab in the Properties dialog box, click Reset Log to back up the current log file and immediately start a new log file.

segment.source: The backup log files are stored in the same folder.
segment.target: The backup log files are stored in the same folder.

segment.source: Click OK or Apply to change the setting.
segment.target: Click OK or Apply to change the setting.
